column4: hmm, my wine registry doesn't have the key HKCU->Software->Wine->Direct3D which should then contain OffscreenRenderingMode,, it has up to Wine, why is this not available? or how do i try to fix the rendering problems in games?
anyone know any other good guides for this stuff?
hmm.. looks like the actual glyphs are not transparent.. only the space between.. is it the same regardless of which font you use?
on the terminal, i changes from system font to monospaced, size and all, wouldn't fix it.
hang.. let me try this on my computer.. see if it's the same
i've noticed it happening in web pages on javascript animations also.
my terminal doesn't look like that.. what version of ubuntu are you running?
and you're running compiz? ie desktop effects?
it would be kind of interesting to know if a live cd has the same effect
tried updating that? I think 180.44 is the current binary driver
i think they have issues with .44, .11 works
oh wait, i'm on 180.51,, arrrg, stupid keyboard.
hehe.. I don't really think the nvidia driver is responsible for drawing glyphs on the screen.. but it might be worth checking
i think there is a more up to date one, but people were giving out saying an earlier one was safer, so i stuck on that one, so that must be 180.51,
